content.rendered:
Devbhoomi Uttarakhand is very well connected to all the nearby and far away destinations in India. Accessible to everyone looking to explore this wonderful land and culture it welcomes not only domestic but international tourists as well making it a melting pot for various different beliefs and traditions. The government of Uttarakhand has worked tirelessly towards making and maintaining strong roads, railway lines, helipads and airports which is why tourism in Uttarakhand is a huge success. Be it pilgrimages to Char Dham or adventure activities you can now make your way through this state without any hassle and reach there in no time at all. No matter which option you choose a lifetime’s worth of memories is guaranteed.

If you are planning on visiting this amazing land of promises, wonderment and culture then here are the preferred modes of transportation that people generally choose for a memorable holiday:

By Road:

This has to be arguably one of the best ways of travelling up to this place. Although being located at such a height and within the jagged terrain the roads here are surprisingly good and very well maintained. They are not only helpful for the tourists visiting Uttarakhand via road from different parts of the country but they also play a major role in connecting various remote and offbeat village locations for the benefit of the locals there. The highways connect all the famous tourist destinations to places like New Delhi, Chandigarh, UP and more. Going on a fun road trip would be the best ways of exploring the awe inspiring beauty this place holds. State and privately owned bus services along with pocket friendly choices for taxi and cab services. Volvo buses are also a great option to choose if you are travelling from some nearby place like Delhi.

By Rail:

If you are travelling on a budget then going by a train journey would be the best choice for you. The prices of the tickets for train are very reasonable and cheap and connect to all the major and minor cities of India. The railway department of Uttarakhand has around 16 railway stations which help in successfully connecting tourists from all over India. Some of the most popular stations here are located in Rishikesh, Dehradun, Tanakpur, Pantnagar, Rudrapur, Nainital; Kathgodam etc. there are various taxi, cab and bus services available just outside these stations. Not only is this option very cheap but is also extremely convenient and very scenic. There are also small stations that connect the travelers within the state of Uttarakhand as well.

By Air:

If you’re travelling budget enables you to travel in luxury or you are running short of time to and don’t want to waste your vacation days then this is the best choice for you. There are several private and commercial airports available one of the most popular airport being the jolly grant airport in Dehradun. The other significant airport is situated in close proximity to Nainital which is the Pantnagar airport. Frequent flights ply from various parts of India connecting the wonderful state of Uttarakhand. If you wish to save some time or complete your journey quickly within a limited number of days then this is the best way of going. Pilgrims and devotees visiting Uttarakhand for pilgrimage purposes choose to travel via helicopter services that open up during the on-season months. There are several helipads near Char Dham temples making accessibility easier and more comfortable especially for people suffering from heart related problems or some physically handicapped and most importantly, pour senior citizens. Remember before booking your flight tickets to check the weather conditions since they stand the chance of being delayed or cancelled in case of worsening climate.

Getting Around:

Due to the presence of numerous strong roads within Uttarakhand, the most convenient and best way of travelling from one place to another within the state would be via the state run buses and shared jeeps. The locals also utilize this way to get from one place to another. If you choose to travel away from the given roads on your own then you may have the option of even going off the route by hitchhiking and walking. There are private buses and taxi services available in most of the towns of places like Nainital, Mussoorie, Ranikhet, Bhimtal and a lot more. Another one of the most convenient ways of getting in and around Uttarakhand is by going on bicycle rides or even rent bikes or cars for a more convenient option.

Travelling in Uttarakhand is not a hassle due to the presence of several options and alternatives focused solely on providing the most memorable holiday of your life not only for you but for your friends, families and loved ones.

  • Wonders of Kumaon Tour
  • Uttarakhand Bird Watching Tour
  • Valley of Flowers Trek Tour
  • Uttarakhand Delights Tour
  • Majestic Kumaon Tour
  • Hills of Kumaon Tour
  • Uttarakhand Heritage Tour
